alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains; Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 3:14PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...SNOW SQUALL... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 314 PM MDT, a snow squall was along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Dinosaur to 13 miles southwest of Rangely and moving east at 20 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Dinosaur around 320 PM MDT. Rangely around 355 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 34. U.S. Highway 40 in Utah between mile markers 164 and 174. Colorado 64 between mile markers 1 and 38. Colorado 139 between mile markers 40 and 72. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&

area.areaDesc: Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains; Tavaputs Plateau
